Tight loops, soft ringlets or ribbony spirals,...
...curly hair has a dynamic all its own.
And now, science has quantified its unique characteristics...
...with applications that far outstrip a curly coif.
Researchers at MIT and the University Pierre and Marie Curie...
...have created the world's first model of the 3-D shape of curly hair,...
...utilizing lab experimentation, existing theory and computer simulation...
...to identify the main parameters for curls.
These were then simplified into two dimensionless parameters:...
...one for curvature, the other for weight.
When factored in with length and thickness,...
...these can predict the shape of any curled strands suspended under its own weight.
From the bottom it seems, where the hooklike curve becomes unstable under its own weight...
...and falls out of a two-dimensional plane into a helix.
And because these dimensionless parameters are infinitely scalable,...
...they can be used to predict the curliness of anything even remotely flexible,...
...from a spool of wire to miles of oil pipeline.
